title: Question for Riot's balancing team
body: Do you guys actually play this game?

replies.body:
Hey everyone, 

I think this thread has probably reached peak usefulness with Riot Sparkle's response, so I'm going to lock it to stop the bickering in the comments. 

Please remember to keep things constructive for Riot on the Boards; it's not helpful to make callouts like this and doesn't typically lead to useful discussion about the game (which is the purpose of the Gameplay sub-board). 

If you have any questions about this, please feel free to visit us on the [Discuss the Boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board or our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/6JevFSb).

--KempyreanPirate

Yes. Every game designer and playtester who works in Gameplay plays League of Legends basically every day (and quite often multiple times a day) whether on internal environments, PBE or the live game. But you knew that, yeah? This isn't really a question, it's one of those "sick burns" that the kids like these days right? :P 

Let me add that as a frequent Boards-goer it's really disappointing to see the same tired, old memes at the top of the front page about the "balance team being silver" and "balance team doesn't even play the game", and I'm not even on the dang balance team. They're simply not true and, real talk from someone on the dev side, I think topics like this can be really discouraging for Rioters who want to come here and talk directly with players.

I always felt bad for the balance team since everyone always posts negatively about them and completely disregard the good changes.  you dont really see people talking about the good changes as much as the bad changes.  I mean, with such a big and complex game, there are going to be a lot of broken aspects that are op, or some champs being trash, but like one minor change can make them interact with certain things completely different, like nerfing the ratios on an ability that is used as waveclear can make that champion's roams much less effective, which is a much huger nerf than intended.  i feel like people need to realize how impactful a small change could be.  I am 100% sure the balance team is trying their best to balance the game, i just wish other people would think the same and support them instead of ranting negatively about them.

because what does good matter if you don't change blatant and obvious things?

Vlad, Sej, Xayah, Kha, and Rakan have been S tier for about a year now and have yet to receive any real changes.
None of those champs are s teir.  Xayah was for about a month or two, but the rest haven't been for a while.

so when Xayah remains pick ban competitive with high stats in solo queue, she's not S tier?

When Sej still has 40% health damage in 1 combo and also has a lot of CC (and CC enables damage), she's still not S tier?

When vlad can poke out every top laner and also outscale them? Still not S tier?

Kha I don't need to explain. He's just been in the top 3 junglers for almost the past year with chain duskblade procs.

Rakan? I don't need to explain this when he's been one of the most contested supports.

Umm no.  They still aren't S teir.
Xayah is only banned 30% of the time, and picked 20% which mean half the time noone even touches her.

I don't think Vlad really out scales most people.  If you're having trouble play someone like Renek or Aatrox. Or even Teemo with Morellos. Or just like Kat in general.

Kha actually is S teir i didnt see him before mb.

Sejuani is, well, Sejuani.  Most junglers and top laners are better.

> Xayah is only banned 30% of the time, and picked 20% which mean half the time noone even touches her

Exactly HALF of the time no one picks or bans her. 

You do realize there are 18 total ADCs/Marksmen. No 1 ADC should ever reach 25% combined Pick/Ban rate Let alone 50%!!

Ezreal is almost 60.
Its pretty common for high end adcs to have inflated pick ban stats since theyre in most games. Over a third of them are above 25%.

logic does not work against those people

especially airkingneo who from nowhere invents S tier champions alone and wants to teach high elo players which champion should be played and which item should be purchased

he told me like a billion of time that bramble vest is broken against bruisers when no one in master tier built it against my renekton and darius while i fought like 50 different sion players
If she's banned 30% of the time, it's an issue... Lol And that's not how stats work.

That is exactly how stats work actually.

And shes high end adc, and has a higher than normal ban rate since a lot of people consider a ban for her to be a ban for Rakan.
wait they all are s tier except kha hes a tier below before this ptch
Kha is the only one who _is_ S teir.

They're simply not true and, real talk from someone on the dev side, I think topics like this can be really discouraging for Rioters who want to come here and talk directly with players.

While balancing is difficult, Riot's track record isn't exactly admirable. You might think they do a good job, I feel I'm on the verge of quitting every time they make a stupid change that endangers my champion, like the recent Sudden Impact changes that were reverted on PBE before they even had an opportunity to be released. I understand PBE is tentative, but this kind of thing feels like it happens all the time. 

It should be a clue when a massive amount of people threaten to quit, over certain changes, that maybe there isn't enough forethought to them. I disagree a single player of Katarina would ever 'thumbs up' that kind of change to her balance, so my assumption is none of you ACTUALLY play Katarina, or the Katarina Tester didn't show up for work that day, and so I feel where the OP is coming from, despite being rude, you, as a company, make extremely controversial decisions. With less people to scream "STOP" you would have easily tanked my favorite champion to a subpar 40% winrate, for who knows how long.

People often considered you(Riot) make balance changes themselves sometimes, purely for the controversy and memes. That is not a good image for your company, if true or not. It also has an origin, so while a meme seems easy to write off, it's still based on some truths from the past. There would be less joking, with less to joke about. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Just going to throw it out there that not as many people want to actually quit as you'd think. Most people just say that when they get frustrated with the game. Honestly I personally think people shouldn't complain about something unless they have a reasonable solution to help fix it. Otherwise it just sounds like people whining. Obviously people are entitled to their opinion so I'm not here to say everyone is wrong that's just my opinion.

Yeah alright, that's fine as your opinion. 

For the record, they could delete Katarina's ultimate, and I'd still play her, but I would have quit on the spot over losing that 8 magic pen. I've started with 20 Magic Pen for years, and Riot just joked about making it 0 through most of my rotations. Many Katarina would have -actually- quit over this, not just me.

It _already_  takes skill to manage its 4s cooldown with 5s a uptime, so whatever Silver player convinced Riot this means 'permanent' is also boosted. It was also nerfed with 0 context...other than Irelia rework being recent, the rune obviously synergizes with Katarina more than any champion- it literally felt like they didn't know this as they nerfed it as Kat continue to take huge winrate drops, they almost end with a nerf worse than everything before it...

You can't even use many broken kat combos now because of the cast time on E, and the way the system tries to execute abilities between two channeling moves, verses one. Like, it's not the most common knowledge, but you can't even spam Katarina abilities anymore without fear of deleting them from que itself, and this 'nerf' isn't even addressed in any notes at all, just an annoying side effect of the E cast time creating an actual problem more substantial than any of her nerfs. It's very easy to test, just try to cast QWE as fast as you can in training, and you will eventually notice it dropping moves. It's just getting ridiculous as a kat player. Remove my Q cast time, make me happy, or something, otherwise it's just endless misery at this point. I have 4 second pentakill clips, where I'm channeling Q and E over 2 entire seconds between resets themselves, and half the play. It's barely enjoyable to execute.
Props for sticking up for your company. Pride in your works important. And the passive aggressiveness in that first part made me laugh, lol

as a frequent board-goer its really disappointing to see the same tired old responses from rioters when they get feedback or criticism, even criticism as blunt and pointless as this thread.

maybe next time try to adequately defend the repeated pattern of poor decisions made by the balance team the last two years instead of getting frustrated and whining that 'people are too mean to us poor rioters on the boards'. grow up. you all are working for a multibillion dollar company on the biggest game in the world and you're bleeding players because of crap like this. respond to criticism. if you don't like it when people make threads like this, don't respond to them, and instead respond to the legion of threads addressing specific points and concerns that have populated these boards for years but you all ignore. you're feeding the monster by responding to personal attacks and not rational criticism.

'discouraging for rioters?' don't make me laugh. it would take an entirely separate post to list the grievances league players have against the balance team for just this season so far, and another for season 7, another for season 6.

Well Riot Sparkle, I want to say that these meme's are a direct ventilation of players frustrations. You can back to the Season's where Morello's Team was doing the balancing for the game and compare it to now with Meddler's Team. There is a vast difference between them, whereas one team took precautions as to not let things spiral out of control the other is trying to hide the fact that they may have messed up and know about it. It's a difference between knowing you've done wrong and hiding it and actively hitting the issues that were created to return the game to a balanced state. As it is now there is too much damage in the game and the game has been balanced around that power creep, Champions and Items, that it creates a game where many people even streamers find it being tedious to continue playing the game. We want the Balance Team to communicate with us and take our feedback seriously, though we may have some biases we are still a reliable source for knowing where to make tweaks. As said previous by some other Rioter: "There are more than a million games played on launch of a new patch, and not every bug will be caught during internal testing as there are a multitude of variables. We make sure to get rid of the BIG bugs before a patch hits live"

dang i would love if a balance team member would respond to my boards at times, cause i am always genuinely curious about things and would just love to hear their thoughts of how things are, such as does anyone think that the assassins being compensated for duskblade nerfs overboard? except perhaps wukong seeing he's been in a bad state. but kha zix and kayn are becoming wayy to strong in the early game.

Oh experience designer...
I played 9 years in this game and spended around 2,5k+ $ just to be know that Riot now doesn't care about my playing experience as a Kalista player.

To be clear: i don't care about pro scene, i don't care how my lovely champion feels on pro plays. I just want to not be fucking garbage champion in my ranked(d4) games where i want to play him.

THEY ARE TALKING ABOUT PREMADES.  NOT PROPLAY.
IF YOU WANT TO PLAY THEM LIKE THAT, PLAY FLEX.

At the same time, I feel like you guys don't even hear our voices at all. I would have loved to sit with a Developer and discuss and argue about the current game situation, current plans or balance changes. In reality however, two things happened when we ask a question: a) It's a question you want to answer and answer it (plain and simple) or b) You ignore it like it never existed.

At the same time I can understand why you guys get annoyed when people roast you and don't give you credit for your work but at the same time, isn't it the same for other games aswell. The thing is, we primarily talk to you for two reasons, feedback and critizism because we players still want to enjoy LoL and we want you therefore to do a good job in balancing it. 

I don't expect you guys to answer every single question (especially the dumb ones). But if there are questions regarding gameplay where players give background information regarding the question, even if it isn't an answer that is satisfying, I would just be happy with getting something because then I feel like you guys have heard my voice and are engaged with the community.

I cannot figure it out!!!!

Anyway. Rant over. I don't expect a reply sadly. Be careful or you'll heamorage players like Blizzard did when they ignored theirs and the playerbase dropped so much they stopped reporting playerbase numbers.

But If I played the game, I'd gut Titanic Hydra because it's OP on ADCs. Kappi.

Technically, he's not wrong. 
On one level you obviously cannot balance everything in the game without playing it or being familiar with the mechanics.
On another level, you don't need to play the game at all to know giving a champion a Karthus-lite ability to ult all towers on the map isn't going to be balanced.

Well but you need to play the game to realise that taking a bit of range off azir and then massively buffing everything about him doesn't exactly fix his kit.
The whole toplane issue wouldn't even exist if they'd actually play the game. 
Also it is a fact that a lot of problems first come visible when you play at a certain level where players aren't complete dogshit and only dogshit and know how to abuse certain things be it champs, items, mechanics. 

They say they play the game yet once again: Azir, Galio, cho gath. 
Fearless jungle changes and NONE of the entire riot team noticed you could get level three before laners even got level 2 in the very first live iteration. They play the game? They change half of the fuckin game basically and didnt even bother to test every jungle route possible?

I hate threads like these. 

I might not agree with the Balanced Team more than half the time, but still, they are doing what they can with the funds and time given to them. SO WHAT? Somethings arent even their decision, they are merely forcing a quota/goal possibly set for them by Tencent.

Please stop bashing the Balance Team and "Consider The Following".

You see, this kind of feedback is just unnecessary. Downvote me all you want, it's not gonna change the fact that you're just antagonizing them instead of actually trying to help. I'm not trying to say that they're doing an awesome or even a good job, I'm just saying that you're being unnecessarily rude. Complaints are warranted, but straight-up insults are not. If you insult them, that's not you being a rightfully dissatisfied player, that's you being just plain hateful. We need to communicate to Riot that the game needs changing, but do you really think that this is going to help?

I have tried to help when it came to my main Azir and they never listened. I wrote constructive feedback, walls of text and was very vocal about him in general and they didn't listen.

Now (to be more specific in the most recent Quick Gameplay Thoughts) we Azir, Kalista and Ryze mains got the finger straight from Meddler himself.

He doesn't intend to say "Fuck you" to us, but he wrote it like that. Antagonize them all you want, I ain't gonna defend a team that told me I'm no longer looked after when it comes to balance just because I'm low elo.
This is...pretty useless feedback to be honest.
